data.what_is:
Cordial's technology helps companies like L.L.Bean, Orveon Global and Boot Barn automate high-conversion messages across email, SMS, mobile app, social media, direct mail and more--driving scalable revenue and lasting customer connections.

Designed with a customer-centric approach, Cordial combines advanced data flexibility with sophisticated adaptive automations and cutting edge AI to ideate, test, and implement new marketing strategies in record time - all in one platform. 

We're an award-winning, high-growth company on a mission to help brands send a better message.

In a recent study commissioned by Cordial, Forrester Consulting found that brands switching to Cordial's marketing platform net $8.79 million in total benefits over 3 years with payback in less than 6 months.

Learn more at www.cordial.com.
data.product_description: Cordial is a next-generation messaging platform built on real-time data. We help marketers leverage their data to create timely, personalized experiences for their customers across channels.Cordial combines advanced data management with email, SMS, and mobile app marketing execution in one platform - helping brands easily use data to engage customers in more meaningful ways.As a cross-channel marketing platform, we simplify your tech stack, streamline the campaign creation process, and increase customer engagement with our sophisticated approach to marketing personalization.Cordila's data-centric platform creates high levels of customer engagement by activating customer data and automating message personalization, eases the pain associated with managing multiple solutions, and helps organizations transform the way they market and pivot to more automated, customer-driven marketing and communication strategies.

features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Based on 13 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: Based on 13 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: Based on 11 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product.

features.name: Customization
features.content: Based on 12 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Based on 10 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: Based on 13 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Based on 11 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Based on 13 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.

features.name: Output Document Generation
features.content: Allows adminstrators to create templates that enable users to quickly generate dynamic documents in various formats based on the data stored in the application.

features.name: Optimization
features.content: Optimizes marketing campaigns for mobile devices.

features.name: Integrations - Mobile Marketing
features.content: Integrates advertising/campaigns into mobile applications, games, and mobile browsers.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Facilitates global text message and mobile marketing campaigns.

features.name: Building and Personalizing Emails
features.content: Based on 25 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Create and design emails with an editor; manage templates; personalize dynamically

features.name: Sending Outbound Emails
features.content: Based on 25 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Create targeted lists, schedule and manage bulk email sending.

features.name: Manage Email Deliverability
features.content: Based on 25 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Ensure inbox delivery. Includes opt-in management, bounce handling, unsubscribe processing, suppression lists, email preview, spam checking, link validation, and delivery monitoring.

features.name: Automated Email Responses
features.content: Based on 21 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Set up automated nurturing emails based on events, online activities, and lead scores

features.name: Landing Pages and Forms
features.content: Based on 11 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Build customized landing pages and lead capture forms for specific marketing campaigns to maximize conversion and to capture the right qualifying information.

features.name: Dynamic Content
features.content: Based on 21 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Dynamically customize emails, forms, and landing pages for specific segments of customers and prospects.

features.name: A/B Testing
features.content: Based on 22 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Test alternate versions of emails, landing pages, and forms. Learn what works, maximize response rates, and increase conversion.

features.name: Mobile Optimized
features.content: Based on 19 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Support mobile-optimized emails, online forms, and landing pages.

features.name: Search Tracking and Optimization
features.content: Based on 10 Cordial reviews. Track performance of keywords and links in major search engines.  Measure search rankings and performance.  Improve page-level SEO with tools to diagnose and improve page performance.  Integrate with Google AdWords.

features.name: Marketing Lead Database
features.content: Based on 13 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. A marketing lead database is the system of record for your most important marketing asset: your leads and contacts. Includes a view of all marketing interactions between each prospect and your company, including website visits, email clicks, scoring changes, and data updates/history.

features.name: Data Quality Management
features.content: Based on 14 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Data quality consists of deduplication, cleansing, and appending your marketing database.

features.name: Segmentation
features.content: Based on 22 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Segment your database and build list of target leads and contacts.  Filter on demographic and company attributes (title, company size, location) as well as behavioral filters and CRM information.

features.name: Lead Scoring and Grading
features.content: Automatically qualify and score leads based on demographics as well as prospect online behaviors, including recency and frequency. Assign your own weights to determine lead scores for prioritization.

features.name: Lead Nurturing
features.content: Based on 17 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automate drip marketing campaigns that send relevant messages over time, based on prospect behaviors and pre-defined campaign steps.

features.name: Online Behavior Tracking
features.content: Based on 15 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Track which emails a prospect opens and clicks, what web-pages they visit, what keywords they use, even what they say on social networks.

features.name: Automated Alerts and Tasks
features.content: Create tasks automatically and provide real-time sales alerts over email, RSS or mobile device.

features.name: CRM Lead Integration
features.content: Based on 12 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Sync lead, contact, account, and opportunity information with your CRM system.

features.name: Program ManagementView full feature definition
features.content: Based on 12 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Manage marketing campaigns and programs across multiple channels, including online ads, video campaigns, mobile, virtual events, and social media. Create and optimize program assets such as landing pages, emails, campaigns, and lists. Track program objectives, results, and costs to assess the program ROI.

features.name: Social Listening
features.content: Monitor what leads and contacts say on sites such as Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn, blogs, and online communities.  Incorporate into your lead and customer DB and use social insights to segment prospects.  Trigger campaigns, and update lead scores.

features.name: Social Sharing
features.content: Add intelligent social share buttons to your campaigns and content.  Track who is sharing your content and driving conversions.

features.name: Social Campaigns
features.content: Schedule automated posts to one or more social accounts; use or integrate with URL shortening services; and measure likes, comments, replies, and retweets.

features.name: Social Media Engagement
features.content: Social apps including polls, sweepstakes, and referral programs can enhance audience engagement.  Include these on your website, landing pages, Facebook pages, and emails.

features.name: Social Media Advertising
features.content: Amplify brand and community stories; Reach customers by social profile and activity; Optimize social ad campaigns in real-time

features.name: Basic Reporting
features.content: Based on 24 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Access pre-built and custom reports and dashboards to measure leads by source/campaign/month, email performance, landing page performance, and web and social activity. Create report subscriptions that can automatically send updates to your team and executives.

features.name: Web Analytics
features.content: Based on 14 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Track which pages prospects and customers visit and how often they come back.  Capture the history in database for lead scoring and sales intelligence. Use anonymous company look-up to identify anonymous visitors.  Send alerts to sales reps of which of their prospects and customers web activity.

features.name: ROI Analytics
features.content: Based on 11 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Measure leads, prospects generated, pipeline, revenue, investment, and ROI by marketing channel or program. The result is that you can see which marketing investments are generating the greatest return and get visibility into how marketing budget should be allocated going forward.

features.name: Revenue Analytics
features.content: Based on 10 Cordial reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Analyze how leads flow through the funnel by measuring stage to stage conversion rates and velocity.  Allocate pipeline and revenue credit among all the marketing activities that have successfully touched an opportunity as it moves through the pipeline.

features.name: SEO / Keyword Analytics
features.content: Monitor and track how you rank for relevant keywords on major search engines and compare your overall performance to competitors.

features.name: Application Attribution
features.content: Attributes app installs to the marketing campaigns and media sources that drove it.

initial_reviews.review_content:

I like best that I can come to my cordial team with ideas for new automations, blocks, anything, and they will be able to make something specific for my needs.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
I dislike how often I run into problems with some of these blocks whether they not be compatible with others or what have you.

initial_reviews.review_title: Efficient and potential tool for empowering email marketing automation
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
The software and its UI are very easy to understand and perform and complete all the tasks with high level of accuracy.
The best and intuitive feature of Cordial is its personalising and customising email feature. And also it supports to send and migrate the data from one server to another.
For marketing over email and social media, everything is possible with Cordial, no limitation or boundation have been experienced here.
Its a very helpful tool for configuring the data and content all at one location, best for optimising the information.
For alligning all your business marketing and campaigning, it has a lot of successing tools for making it possible for you.
The most amazing feature of it is that it has wide range of advanced features, and has the capability and ability of handling multiple social media handles simultaneously.
The automated tools here are very helpful, the AI tools will make the marketing work fully automated and will consume less time in processing. This will basically result in increasing of business and productivity.
The automated email marketing and social marketing helps in targeting and gathering more and more interested audience towards your services.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
The report geenration feature is quite not working properly, and does not provide proper and analytical results everytime you require to generate reports.
Splting of window or screen or duplicating the screen is quite complex and difficult at some instances, does not support this feature while processing any automation or uploading.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
Making it possible for us in processing and publishing automation marketing, and the wide varierty of AI tools helps in doing the marketing work in our organisation intuitively.
Helped a lot in making a good connection with customers by regulary engaging them with automated emails and campaigns over social medias.

initial_reviews.review_title: Rapid migration and upgrading to Shopify in under 10 months
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
Very customizable and easy to adapt both the browser-based UI and API to any system requirements. Support staff goes above and beyond to deliver results

What do you dislike about Cordial?
Login timeouts always appear between tasks or looking away to answer an email. Can be tricky to duplicate a window to view user event data while coding.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email Capture, Marketing Automation, Abandon Cart, Notify when back-in-stock, Email Segmentation and Reactivation, Post Purchase marketing, Transactional Emails.

initial_reviews.review_title: Great in theory and good collab partners
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
Cordial is very willing to identify and work on custom solutions for a brand, even if this is not something already a part of their suite of products.  They have friendly account managers and technical support that's always lookign to service us.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
I don't think the Cordial platform is extremely user friendly for business owners that aren't technically inclined.  It takes awhile to get used to the system and even those that are in it everyday, often have to defer to our account manager.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
Cordial is solving our ability to pivot quickly without hand coding different email variations.  We are also able to test out theories thanks to the block system of building emails.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
The underlying technology supporting the platform is incredibly well built, utilizing modern tech with a focus on scalability and speed. They also are constantly upgrading and adding new features. Their documentation is well put together and our support team is always available to assist (usually within minutes) for any questions we have.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
There really isn't anything that we dislike, it's been a fantastic partnership with a great product that is essential for us to run our business.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were primarily looking for a new ESP platform to replace our existing but very dated provider. We have some nuance around our data model and how we manage the integration to drive contact profile data, and Cordial had the flexibility to support our needs out of the box. They also have a very well developed solution for managing data and information about sends at a granular level that made it incredibly easy for us to quickly get up and running. With our old platform, we were spending a lot of energy on maintenance and operational overhead, whereas with Cordial we can focus instead on crafting and sending effective communications.

Also, Cordial makes it incredibly easy to scale emails, through really crisp and easy automation capabilities and an incredibly intuitive template builder. We were able to drastically reduce the number of templates we were managing (before we were creating each email from scratch) through effective use of templating content and support for easy dropping in of variable based / dynamic content.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
Completely customizable - if you can dream it, you can build it.  There seems to be no limit to what contact level data you can put in the platform then leverage for triggers, personalization or segmentation in emails or other messages.

Documentation is very good, and all the tools to customize and build on it are at your disposal.  If you like to be self-sufficient, this is the perfect tool.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
Significant learning curve, and you need to have a developer-type on your team in order to leverage the tool to any extent.  Much of the functionality is implemented using "Smarty" code.  This gives it its power, but it's not for the faint-of-heart.  If you're used to an email tool with a canned WYSIWYG editor, your transition will be difficult.  Once you set up your templates and building-blocks, however, non-technical users can use the tool pretty easily.

Recommendations to others considering Cordial:
Cordial is a great option if you have a strong internal team with good technical abilities and good strategic ideas.  If you need the vendor to provide pre-built templates and programs, there are better choices.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've dramatically cut down on the time it takes to create ecommerce emails with lots of products.  We can pull in products dynamically from our catalog, create rules around who sees what product, create rules around who gets what email, etc.

We've seen performance improvements in open rates, click-throughs and revenues by sending more relevant and timely emails to our customers.

initial_reviews.review_title: Very good experience so far, tool has high potential.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
- Onboarding was very fast. Only took us a few weeks and we have a large list (over 1 million)

- Strong support so far. They have helped us customize our implementation and build out some cool features.

- Once you get sculpt set up, building and scheduling messages is a lot easier. There is definitely some upfront work that needs to be done, but once completed, it makes life a lot easier. Scheduling and unscheduling sends is also easy. We had to go through a four-step process to schedule a message in our last ESP. With Cordial, once a message is built, you plug in the time and press a button.

- Their journey tool is pretty straightforward compared to other tools I have used. It may not be the most complex but you also don't need to be a developer to use it.

- It builds audience segments extremely quickly and in real-time. Also the tagging capability can be very powerful for segmentation. You can also see how different segments performed within an email without having to split the message into multiple segments

What do you dislike about Cordial?
- Interface is still a bit of a work in progress. There are some features that are more fleshed out in more established ESPs that Cordial is still working on. However, they are very willing to take input and suggestions.

- You do need their expertise to help fully build out your implementation unless you have some hard-core developers on your team, but this is the case with any enterprise tool

- Would like to have some foldering capabilities

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed a less cumbersome,less expensive and more modern tool that would allow us to send more personalized, targeted messages. We also wanted more support and a better partnership. We have seen higher revenue since moving to Cordial and we are starting to use more of the personalization features. We still have a ways to go, but I am more confident that we could get there with Cordial than with our old ESP

initial_reviews.review_title: Personalized email and push notification messages
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
1. The cordial team is extremely efficient and helped us integrate their product.
2. Orchestrated message automation. Ability to tie these automated messages to custom events is very powerful.
3. We can send push notifications to user(s) based on custom attributes (email id / members of certain group etc).
4. Really good developer documentation.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
Since we are part of the beta testing group there were some bugs which had a small impact on our timeline. However the Cordial team was quick to address these (the point of beta program was to identify these bugs anyway).

Recommendations to others considering Cordial:
There is a engineering effort in integrating with Cordial. I would make sure you have thought about how and what kind of events your product is firing and looking to tie that into how you can use that from Cordial.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
We want to send automated push notification / emails based on certain event and Cordial is the perfect tool in this regard. Moreover Cordial's Podium is a really powerful tool to orchestrate custom, complex rules based messaging very quickly.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
We have gotten full support from the Cordial team during our migration to the platform. They've been responsive, available, and patient in helping us understand the platform and getting it set up. The platform makes it easy to ingest the data I need and use it in campaigns, making personalization easy. We're able to link any of our platforms to Cordial, pulling data from multiple sources. There has been no lag in sends, and any issues that have been discovered have been solved promptly by the Cordial team.

The team is also always open to feedback and recommendations for product enhancements. They're open about their roadmap and willing to prioritize items that are detrimental to brands.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
So far, we haven't had any issues with Cordial. The few bugs that have been found have been taken care of promptly by the Cordial team. I do wish that the reporting was more robust and customizable, but this is something that's on their roadmap for 2020.

Recommendations to others considering Cordial:
Make sure you either purchase hours from Cordial or have the internal power to build out the necessary integrations so your data flows into Cordial appropriately.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to pull any data from our data warehouse to use for segmentation and personalization, something we weren't able to do before.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
The underlying technology supporting the platform is incredibly well built, utilizing modern tech with a focus on scalability and speed. They also are constantly upgrading and adding new features. Their documentation is well put together and our support team is always available to assist (usually within minutes) for any questions we have.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
There really isn't anything that we dislike, it's been a fantastic partnership with a great product that is essential for us to run our business.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were primarily looking for a new ESP platform to replace our existing but very dated provider. We have some nuance around our data model and how we manage the integration to drive contact profile data, and Cordial had the flexibility to support our needs out of the box. They also have a very well developed solution for managing data and information about sends at a granular level that made it incredibly easy for us to quickly get up and running. With our old platform, we were spending a lot of energy on maintenance and operational overhead, whereas with Cordial we can focus instead on crafting and sending effective communications.

Also, Cordial makes it incredibly easy to scale emails, through really crisp and easy automation capabilities and an incredibly intuitive template builder. We were able to drastically reduce the number of templates we were managing (before we were creating each email from scratch) through effective use of templating content and support for easy dropping in of variable based / dynamic content.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
Completely customizable - if you can dream it, you can build it.  There seems to be no limit to what contact level data you can put in the platform then leverage for triggers, personalization or segmentation in emails or other messages.

Documentation is very good, and all the tools to customize and build on it are at your disposal.  If you like to be self-sufficient, this is the perfect tool.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
Significant learning curve, and you need to have a developer-type on your team in order to leverage the tool to any extent.  Much of the functionality is implemented using "Smarty" code.  This gives it its power, but it's not for the faint-of-heart.  If you're used to an email tool with a canned WYSIWYG editor, your transition will be difficult.  Once you set up your templates and building-blocks, however, non-technical users can use the tool pretty easily.

Recommendations to others considering Cordial:
Cordial is a great option if you have a strong internal team with good technical abilities and good strategic ideas.  If you need the vendor to provide pre-built templates and programs, there are better choices.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've dramatically cut down on the time it takes to create ecommerce emails with lots of products.  We can pull in products dynamically from our catalog, create rules around who sees what product, create rules around who gets what email, etc.

We've seen performance improvements in open rates, click-throughs and revenues by sending more relevant and timely emails to our customers.

all_reviews.review_title: Very good experience so far, tool has high potential.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
- Onboarding was very fast. Only took us a few weeks and we have a large list (over 1 million)

- Strong support so far. They have helped us customize our implementation and build out some cool features.

- Once you get sculpt set up, building and scheduling messages is a lot easier. There is definitely some upfront work that needs to be done, but once completed, it makes life a lot easier. Scheduling and unscheduling sends is also easy. We had to go through a four-step process to schedule a message in our last ESP. With Cordial, once a message is built, you plug in the time and press a button.

- Their journey tool is pretty straightforward compared to other tools I have used. It may not be the most complex but you also don't need to be a developer to use it.

- It builds audience segments extremely quickly and in real-time. Also the tagging capability can be very powerful for segmentation. You can also see how different segments performed within an email without having to split the message into multiple segments

What do you dislike about Cordial?
- Interface is still a bit of a work in progress. There are some features that are more fleshed out in more established ESPs that Cordial is still working on. However, they are very willing to take input and suggestions.

- You do need their expertise to help fully build out your implementation unless you have some hard-core developers on your team, but this is the case with any enterprise tool

- Would like to have some foldering capabilities

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed a less cumbersome,less expensive and more modern tool that would allow us to send more personalized, targeted messages. We also wanted more support and a better partnership. We have seen higher revenue since moving to Cordial and we are starting to use more of the personalization features. We still have a ways to go, but I am more confident that we could get there with Cordial than with our old ESP

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
Cordial's team of experts makes email marketing a breeze. Melanie & Evan are available at a moment's notice to help our brand strategize a flash sale or automation campaign, with the kind of white glove treatment you don't expect from tech vendors nowadays. Their exposure to all industries and proven success at this is clear in their high return recommendations.

What do you dislike about Cordial?

Recommendations to others considering Cordial:

What do you like best about Cordial?

2. Orchestrated message automation. Ability to tie these automated messages to custom events is very powerful.
3. We can send push notifications to user(s) based on custom attributes (email id / members of certain group etc).
4. Really good developer documentation.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
Since we are part of the beta testing group there were some bugs which had a small impact on our timeline. However the Cordial team was quick to address these (the point of beta program was to identify these bugs anyway).

Recommendations to others considering Cordial:
There is a engineering effort in integrating with Cordial. I would make sure you have thought about how and what kind of events your product is firing and looking to tie that into how you can use that from Cordial.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
We have gotten full support from the Cordial team during our migration to the platform. They've been responsive, available, and patient in helping us understand the platform and getting it set up. The platform makes it easy to ingest the data I need and use it in campaigns, making personalization easy. We're able to link any of our platforms to Cordial, pulling data from multiple sources. There has been no lag in sends, and any issues that have been discovered have been solved promptly by the Cordial team.

The team is also always open to feedback and recommendations for product enhancements. They're open about their roadmap and willing to prioritize items that are detrimental to brands.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
So far, we haven't had any issues with Cordial. The few bugs that have been found have been taken care of promptly by the Cordial team. I do wish that the reporting was more robust and customizable, but this is something that's on their roadmap for 2020.

Recommendations to others considering Cordial:
Make sure you either purchase hours from Cordial or have the internal power to build out the necessary integrations so your data flows into Cordial appropriately.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to pull any data from our data warehouse to use for segmentation and personalization, something we weren't able to do before.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
1. Marketing friendly functionality. Traditional enterprise level ESPs are super powerful but require a massive team and engineering support to unlock the functionality. That leads to high costs and slow development. In contrast, Cordial allows for quick configuration of triggered emails by non-technical employees. And, with some tech support you can still have the data driven complex options. For example with an enterprise level solution it took 6 months to configure a basic Abandon Cart and Abandon Browse series, with Cordial it took 1 week.

2. Support. The Cordial team knows their tool well, are incredibly responsive and a joy to work with. With previous enterprise level tools we got passed from team to team with each group having no knowledge of our objectives, our configuration, or their own toolset. And response time was terrible. It often took weeks to resolve high priority incidents, with Cordial we solve issues in hours.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
None at this time. There is some functionality we eventually want that isn't ready yet like price drop messaging, but it is on their near term roadmap.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
Cordial has driven triple digit revenue growth in email automation. We've made more progress in email experience in 3 months than the previous 3 years on an enterprise level tool.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
Cordial is a robust platform that really delivers when it comes to flexibility and performance. With its many audience targeting rules and segmentation features,  machine learning technology (for content optimization experiments), contact list management, custom reporting & analytics, inbox placement tests, personalization features, and image hosting, you have all the tools you need to create a successful B2C email program. (I'm sure there's more I'm forgetting!)

What do you dislike about Cordial?
The lack of a WYSIWYG editor initially created a steep learning curve for our lean marketing department. HTML/CSS proficiency is required as well as having a basic understanding of javascript/JSON. Over time, we learned and adapted, and it was no longer a problem. Fortunately, Cordial his releasing a sculpt editor this year!

Recommendations to others considering Cordial:
Educated yourself on the product. You are your only limiting factor.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
B2C direct marketing and communication.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
Cordial's overall ease of use has really impressed me after using another enterprise platform for several years. It did not take me long to get our email campaigns sending again during our transition period and I never feel like I am drowning in views or set up screens.  What used to takes 4 screens of options and a few deep platform settings changes is usually done with few clicks.

Filtering the audiences for sends is easy and intuitive. New features and tweaks are added almost monthly but never really disrupt the overall flow of the UI.

*Best Feature -> Their staff is incredibly helpful and responsive to email and help tickets. This is so critical when dealing with marketing deadlines. You won't wait hours and hours for replies.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
Would be nice to have the option to export more of email performance and audience trends as a CSV versus an image.

Filtering audiences based on the non-subscriber data is still in the works. Have had to work around this for some sends.

Dynamic content and a/b testing body content requires scripting and may not be easy for end-user types.  and you will have to take a deep dive on the how your product/site/subscriber data is stored before you send more sofiticated emails. (I am sure this is case for most ecommerce related applications)

Would be nice to see a few more options for out of the box intergrations with other marketing software.

Recommendations to others considering Cordial:
I would take the extra time to build out the product/order data that feeds into Cordial. This will make your life easier down the road and you will have more options when filtering your audiences and creating more personalised messaging.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
The ability to send cart, browse abandonment and triggered/retargeted emails has shifted the whole focus of our email program.  These are great sales closing tools and we have seen these emails, direct on-the-fence customers, to reach out to our customer service team.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Cordial?
The Sculpt feature that allows you to customize a block of HTML to reuse on any email.

What do you dislike about Cordial?
For me writing the smarty code is the hardest or most disliked part.

Recommendations to others considering Cordial:
Make sure you have a good digital marketer in place that understands how to take advantage of all the features Coridal has.  It would be beneficial if the main user of the product has HTML experience.

What problems is Cordial solving and how is that benefiting you?
First and foremost the time it takes to create an email has been shortened a great deal.  It took work to create all of the sculpt blocks but now that those are done creating an email is very fast.
